reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: In Lebanon no national strategy exists to improve the current figures (3.1%) of participation in Parliament. This 6 months project aims to identify 15 women across Lebanon willing to present their candidacy for the parliamentary elections due in May-June 2 017. Once identified these and 300 others can enroll in empowering programs and activities will build stronger coalitions between women and find support in their districts. The awareness sessions will take place January + February 2017 to encourage women t o present their candidacy and men to support them. Topics will include: active citizenship women participation to decision making procedures of candidacy quotas etc will be tackled. During these sessions committed candidates will fill an application to joi n the network of their mohafaza. In addition public awareness about the importance of women's participation will be raised through communication. The objectives are to: - Identify women candidates for Elections - Increase the number of women candidates - I ncrease the awareness knowledge and confidence of candidates regarding election procedures and the importance of female participation- Contribute in stating a more democratic and gender balanced electoral processActivities include: - Recruitment of project staff and 8 focal points that will conduct the awareness sessions and create the networks; - Project branding; - Training of the focal persons; - Awareness sessions in 5 mohafazats; - Meetings organized by each focal point to create a network among women
